Question.question: How can we protect accidental termination of our instances?
Question.option1: By using security group and disabling remote access to instances.
Question.option4: We can not prevent accidental termination.

Question.question: How can we attach our instance store volume to another instance?
Question.option1: We can use 'force detach' and then attach to another instance.
Question.option2: We can use 'detach volume' and then attach to another instance.
Question.option3: We can not detach instance or attach instance store volume.
Question.option4: We can stop the instance. Dech the volume and attach to other instance.

Question.question: Is it possible to create an AMI while an instance is running?
Question.option1: Yes, if only 'no reboot' option is checked.
Question.option2: Yes, only if it is Linux instance
Question.option3: No, instance should be stopped and rebooted
Question.option4: Yes, AMI can be created without any change

Question.question: Is it possible to change an instance type after it has been created?
Question.option1: Instance type can not be changed.
Question.option2: Type can be changed if it has an EBS store volume root device
Question.option3: Type can be changed if it has an instance store volume root device

Question.question: If any change is made to a security group rule, when are these changes effective?
Question.option1: Changes are automatically applied after a short period
Question.option2: Changes will be effective after rebooting the instances in that security group
Question.option3: Security group rules can not be changed. You have to create a new security group and assign it to instances
Question.option4: Changes will be effective after 5 minutes

Question.question: How can an instance be copied to another region?
Question.option1: By stopping instance and using copy option
Question.option2: There is no way to copy an instance to another region
Question.option3: First instance's root volume is detached. Then a new instance is created in another region. Finally detached volume can be attached to new instance as root device
Question.option4: By creating an AMI and copy it to another region

Question.question: How can you change the instance type used in Auto Scaling group?
Question.option1: As group should be deleted and recreated
Question.option2: Instances should be stopped and then type can be changed
Question.option3: A new launch configuration with a new instance type should be created and attached to AS group
Question.option4: It is not possible to change the instance type

Question.question: Which record type queries are free when using Route 53?
What three attributes are selectable when creating an EBS volume for an EC2 instance?
What is EC2 instance protection?
Question.option1: Prevents Auto Scaling from selecting specific EC2 instance for termination when scaling out
Question.option2: Prevents Auto Scaling from selecting specific EC2 instance for termination when scaling in
Question.option3: Prevents Auto Scaling from selecting specific EC2 instance for termination when paused
Question.option4: Prevents Auto Scaling from selecting specific EC2 instance for termination when stopped

Question.question: What are three standard AWS pricing models?
How is an EBS root volume created when launching an EC2 instance from a new EBS-backed AMI?
What Amazon AWS sources are available for creating an EBS-Backed Linux AMI?(select two)
) What is required to prevent an instance from being launched and incurring costs?
Question.option4: stop, deregister AMI and terminate instance

Question.question: What is an EBS Snapshot?
Question.option1: backup of an EBS root volume and instance data

Question.question: Where are ELB and Auto-Scaling groups deployed as a unified solution for horizontal scaling?
What feature is supported when attaching or detaching an EBS volume from an EC2 instance?
Question.option1: EBS volume can be attached and detached to an EC2 instance in the same region
Question.option2: EBS volume can be attached and detached to an EC2 instance that is cross-region
Question.option3: EBS volume can only be copied and attached to an EC2 instance that is cross-region
Question.option4: EBS volume can only be attached and detached to an EC2 instance in the same Availability Zone

Question.question: What two statements correctly describe how to add or modify IAM roles to a running EC2 instance?
Question.option1: attach an IAM role to an existing EC2 instance from the EC2 console
Question.option2: replace an IAM role attached to an existing EC2 instance from the EC2 Console
Question.option3: attach an IAM role to the user account and relaunch the EC2 instance
Question.option4: add the EC2 instance to a group where the role is a member

Question.question: What is the default behavior for an EC2 instance when terminated? (Select two)
Question.option2: EBS root device volume and additional attached volumes are deleted Immediately
Question.option3: EBS data volumes that you attach at launch persist
Question.option4: EBS root device volume is automatically deleted when instance Terminates

Question.question: How do you launch an EC2 instance after it is terminated? (Select two)
Question.option1: launch a new instance using the same AMI
Question.option3: launch a new instance from a Snapshot

Question.question: What will cause AWS to terminate an EC2 instance on launch? (Select two)
Question.option2: number of EC2 instances on AWS account exceeded
Question.option4: multiple IP addresses assigned to instance

Question.question: You recently made some configuration changes to an EC2 instance.You then launched a new EC2 instance from the same AMI however none of the settings were saved. What is the cause of this error?
Question.option1: did not save configuration changes to EC2 instance
Question.option2: did not save configuration changes to AMI
Question.option4: did not reboot EC2 instance to enable changes

Question.question: What statements are correct concerning DisableApiTermination attribute? (Select two)
Question.option1: cannot enable termination protection for Spot instances
Question.option2: termination protection is disabled by default for an EC2 instance
Question.option3: termination protection is enabled by default for an EC2 instance
Question.option4: can enable termination protection for Spot instances

Question.question: You have developed a web-based application for file sharing that will allow customers to access files.There are a variety of sizes that include larger .pdf and video files. What two solution stacks could tenants use for an online file sharing service? (Select two)
What infrastructure services are provided to EC2 instances? (Select three)
How is capacity (compute,storage and network speed) managed and assigned to EC2 instances?
What storage type enable permanent attachment of volumes to EC2 instances?
What is the recommended method for migrating (copying) an EC2 instance to a different region?
Question.option1: terminate instance,select region, copy instance to destination region
Question.option2: select AMI associated with EC2 instance and use Copy AMI option
Question.option3: stop instance and copy AMI to destination region
Question.option4: cross-region copy is not currently supported

Question.question: What are two attributes that define an EC2 instance type?
How is an Amazon Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) assigned?
What is the default maximum number of Elastic IP addresses assignable per Amazon AWS region?
How are snapshots for an EBS volume created when it is the root device for an instance?
Question.option1: pause instance, unmount volume and snapshot
Question.option4: stop instance, unmount volume and snapshot

Question.question: What cloud compute components are configured by tenants and not Amazon AWS support engineers? (Select three)
What three characteristics or limitations differentiate EC2 instance types?
